title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: The Sleep Debt Tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users visualize and manage their sleep debt. This application provides a user-friendly interface to track sleep schedules, calculate accumulated sleep debt, and offer insights to improve sleep habits, making it a useful tool for anyone interested in optimizing their rest.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a modern, responsive dashboard project built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, demonstrating best practices for building scalable web applications. It showcases key features like data fetching, UI component composition, and routing within the Next.js framework, offering a solid foundation for building custom dashboards and complex web interfaces. This project serves as a practical example for developers looking to learn and implement robust front-end solutions using the latest web technologies.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a personal project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, exploring modern web development techniques. This repository serves as a learning ground for implementing best practices and experimenting with new features in front-end development, focusing on project-based learning and practical application of these technologies.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: Robofleet-dashboard is a web-based interface built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS designed to provide a comprehensive visualization and monitoring solution for Robofleet robot fleets. This project enables users to track robot status, monitor performance metrics, and manage robot operations, offering a user-friendly dashboard for enhanced robot fleet management.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a project leveraging TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript to create a dynamic and collaborative platform for brainstorming and organizing ideas. Built with modern web technologies, this application provides a visually appealing and intuitive interface for users to capture, categorize, and develop their ideas, making it a valuable tool for project planning and creative collaboration.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) for a streamlined and visually appealing developer dashboard experience. Leveraging React Query for efficient data fetching and management, this project serves as a practical example of modern web development techniques and showcases best practices for structuring a complex application with reusable components and type-safe code. It covers topics such as component-based architecture, data fetching strategies, and UI design principles within the context of a developer-focused tool.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the TeX source code and generated HTML for my resume. It serves as a project to showcase my skills in document preparation using TeX and web development with HTML, allowing for both print-ready and online versions of my professional information.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a full-stack web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to provide a simple and intuitive platform for creating and participating in polls and voting processes. This project showcases modern web development techniques and best practices, focusing on a user-friendly interface and efficient data handling to enable quick and easy voting experiences.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a project demonstrating a responsive and interactive event calendar built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository showcases how to dynamically generate calendar views, manage events, and create a user-friendly interface for visualizing schedules, all within a project context.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository houses a modern, full-stack IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Supabase. Leveraging Tailwind CSS for styling and JavaScript for dynamic functionalities, the project enables users to monitor and manage assets in real-time, showcasing a practical implementation of serverless architecture and modern web development best practices within the context of IoT solutions.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, Vite.js, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API for [briefly describe the application's core function, e.g., AI-powered conversations, creative writing assistance, etc.]. This project explores the integration of cutting-edge AI technology with modern web development practices, focusing on efficient front-end development using Vite and robust back-end services with Express, showcasing a practical application of the Gemini API within a modern web environment.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL, utilizing HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting for a complete web-based experience. This project showcases practical application development principles and demonstrates proficiency in connecting front-end interfaces with back-end database systems, covering key topics such as data management, web server interactions, and overall project structure within a Python environment.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project showcasing interactive map visualizations built using HTML for the frontend and Python for data processing and map rendering. This repository demonstrates techniques for displaying geographical data and creating engaging visual representations on a map, focusing on practical application and implementation of mapping concepts.

title: atg-world
description: atg-world is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS focused on [mention the project's purpose based on the README, e.g., "visualizing global data," "creating an interactive world map," or "developing a geospatial web application"].  This repository showcases [mention a key feature or functionality, e.g., "dynamic data loading," "responsive design," or "real-time updates"] and explores concepts related to [mention specific topics from the README if available, e.g., "data visualization techniques," "interactive map development," or "geospatial data processing"].

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting designed to visualize and analyze ROS (Robot Operating System) log files, providing a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and interpret ROS log data for debugging and performance analysis in robotics projects. This project aims to streamline the ROS development process by offering a convenient and insightful way to understand system behavior through log examination.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository hosts a collection of Jupyter Notebooks and Python scripts dedicated to exploring financial concepts and building practical projects. It leverages Python's powerful data analysis and visualization libraries to delve into topics like stock market analysis, portfolio optimization, and financial modeling. Designed for hands-on learning, this project provides a starting point for anyone interested in applying Python to solve real-world finance problems.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a full-stack e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and React, showcasing a modern and type-safe approach to web development.  Leveraging MUI for a responsive and accessible user interface and React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, this repository provides a practical example of building a complete online shopping experience focused on fruit sales, covering key topics like e-commerce architecture, UI implementation, and data management.
